physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Profound T-cell lymphopenia and no detectable T-cell receptor excision circles (TRECs). Presence of neonatal teeth, hypotonia, an umbilical hernia, and erythematous psoriaform dermatitis responsive to treatment. Imaging revealed wormian skull bones, mild pulmonary artery stenosis, and the absence of a corpus callosum.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially presented with T-cell lymphopenia and lack of TRECs, but later showed full T-cell engraftment and normal proliferation to phytohemagglutinin after stem cell transplantation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: CD3+ T-cell count: 182 cells/μl; CD4+ helper T-cell count: 130 cells/μl; CD8+ cytotoxic T-cell count: 26 cells/μl; no naive CD4+ T cells detected; proliferative response to phytohemagglutinin was only 18%.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially abnormal levels, with improvement in counts at 2 years of age.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: CD3+ T-cell count: 2157 cells/μl; CD4+ helper T-cell count: 1239 cells/μl; CD8+ cytotoxic T-cell count: 826 cells/μl; showed protection from vaccine responses due to full T-cell function.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant improvement noted in T-cell counts and functioning.
